citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
On January 16th, a pig underwent a procedure to induce diabetes. The protocol approved at the time of the procedure
describes hypoglycemia in the immediate post-procedural period as a possible complication and describes overnight
monitoring and a treatment plan for hypoglycemia. The protocol further specifies that animals with progressive clinical
conditions that are unresponsive to treatment will be euthanized.
After the procedure, the animal developed symptomatic hypoglycemia at ~2:30pm and was treated, per protocol, with
fluids and dextrose. Over the following 12 hours, the animal developed persistent, severe hypoglycemia that became
refractory to treatment. Early in the morning of January 17, 2024, the animal became lethargic, disoriented, and had
difficulty breathing and subsequently died at ~3:30am.
Maintaining the animal on study when the procedures described in the protocol were unsuccessful at resolving a
progressive clinical condition constituted a significant change that did not undergo IACUC review and approval. In order
for the IACUC to be able to fulfill its responsibilities under the AWA, the IACUC must review and approve significant
changes regarding the use of animals in ongoing activities prior to implementation.
This incident was voluntarily reported to the USDA and corrective measures had been implemented prior to inspection. To
remain corrected after September 17, 2024.

This facility's annual contingency plan review has not been documented since 2022. Each registrant must maintain
documentation of their annual reviews, including documenting any amendments or changes made since the previous
year's review. To be corrected by ensuring that documentation of the contingency plan annual review is maintained and
made available to APHIS upon request. Correct for any contingency review conducted after September 17, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
